*think

In all the years I've been downloading stuff this is easily the biggest pile of dogshit I've ever wasted bandwidth on.

It is a single AVI - no rars - and I would give it 1/10 for audio and 1/10 for video.  In fact it's unwatchable - I deleted it within minutes of first checking it.

DVD-R is a lie, plain and simple.  It is a cam, and a cam of zero quality.  It might go down well in Romania but Cobra666 should be impaled on a large stick and be eaten by the ghoulies for pretending this is anything other than total crap.

No bogwart, you should be impaled on a large stick and be eaten by the ghoulies ... for saying such crap: Video 0 out of ten...
In this case, Blu-Ray Quality for you, on a scale from zero to ten, would probably be: one, one and a half maximum.
And no, the source is the DDC ( wide screen, excelent video quality, and yes i have to admit that even though is stereo sound, the audio quality isn't that great: 5,5 - 6 )
Cobra can you hear it on regular dvd player, I am not all that picky; I just want this great movie. And can you find Nightmare on the 13th Floor? It's an axe-murderer type movie thnx if u can.

Well JeremyBradley ... about your question regarding the regular DVD Players...I don't know what to say: On a DVD Player Panasonic DVD-S33E-K, there weren't any problems with hearing or seeing, but one of my neighbours has a DVD Player Samsung P171, and he only got the sound on his player, but no video... and both DVD Players are cheap, regular ones.
So...I don't know exactly what to tell you...I ope my answer clarified your question.

And now, about: "Nightmare on 13th floor"...i'll notify you here if/when i'll upload it here on TPB.

hi cobra 666 I would just like to say that I have a crappy $39 DVD player I bought from crazy clarks a year and a half ago and a sony stereo that has great sound and bass and I thought it was great to watch thanks. 
And to all who bag cobra666, get fucked
thank you the_fatman76, for your kind words regarding my movie's quality.

Good job Cobra, but I have to say that the quality claims you made are misleading. It is better quality than a standard movie (700mb) but not by much. Also, the size of the video is not very large, so when blown-up the quality disintegrates to that of a standard movie. THe only problem is that the movie is 3.88 GiB and you can download a large size, HD movie for that much space. Personally I think the the HD is the better bet. Sorry :(

Hey, this Movie looked Great! The Sound needed the Bass turned down a bit, but it sounded good also.
V= 9 (little choppy at times)
A= 8
Fully enjoyed the Flick.
Thanks Cobra!
